hypothesis_content.title: Stress-to-Bull Regime Transition via 3-Day VIX Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a STRESS regime (VIX > 25, SPX 20-day volatility > 18%), a 3-day compression in VIX (daily range < 2 points) followed by a breakout below 22.5 will signal a transition to BULL regime, with BTC leading risk-on assets higher within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: VIX compression during stress periods often precedes regime shifts. A breakdown below 22.5 suggests fear is receding. BTC, as a high-beta risk asset, should lead the recovery as capital rotates from safety to risk.
entry_conditions: VIX shows 3 consecutive days with daily range < 2.0 points

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC gains 8% from entry within 5 days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: VIX reclaims 25.0 or BTC drops 4% from entry
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: VIX breakdown occurs but BTC fails to rally >3% within 5 days, or continues to decline while SPX rallies (decoupling).
